description: "Meet the Real Beauty and the Beast"
"Sophisticated" is the name of a 2 page text story in this issue.
name: Sophisticated

description: "The White Dress" is the name of a 2 page text story in this issue.
name: The White Dress

description:
Space cruisers, admiral ships, war transports, maintenance shuttles...by the thousands! A formidable convoy launc hed in search of new livable planets. A convoy named Wake upon which one can encounter all manner of races, intelligences, peoples but where one race remains as yet unknown: human beings.

They are about to run into Navee, a feisty young girl shipwrecked on a lush uninhabited planet who’s grown up and fended entirely for herself. Contrary to all on Wake who are either mind controllers or controlled, she is neither and that makes her very dangerous.

This is the very first issue where we discover the main characters as Navee (Nävis in French), Bobo the alien and Houyo the tiger and where we discover the convoy called Wake. This convoy has come to colonize her planet as it does for every planet on its way. She will struggle to escape from the aliens and robots in charge of kidnapping her but finally will be caught and send to one of the Wake's spaceship.

The reason why Navee will be taken alive is because she's from a different species from others... She's human. Thus she has different abilities, lifestyles, and behaviours than aliens.
name: Fire & Ash

description: Taken aboard Wake, Navee proves irresistible to its powers. Her resistance to being mind-read, her feistiness and indomitable character make her a popular new guest at increasingly higher echelons. In this volume, she undergoes training for special missions and does so with flying colors. But when she turns down the advances of a prominent official smitten with her, dangerous backstabbing politicking puts her in grave danger…
name: Private Collection

description: Navee is assigned a mission by Wake to investigate the steam-punk world of planet TRI-JJ 68. It’s a glacial planet that had been inhabited by a nature-communing, peaceful lot that Wake simply passed over as unworthy. But in a recent pass, they discover that suddenly a whole civilization has sprouted and reached up to its industrial age, and this in record time! Wake is now intrigued and so is Navee, as these new inhabitants closely resemble the race of which, up until now, she had been the only representative: humans! Has she found her own people?
name: Gearing Up

description: Inaugurating a new format: 2 stories in one thick book! In a remarkably poignant and topical story, Navee is pressed into service against a group of terrorists bombing at random throughout Wake! The group is an oppressed neglected people whose anger is beyond cooling but the victims they make are innocent... In the second story, agents from Wake on mission on Hurumaru, a planet in medieval stage, are giving no sign of life. Navee, Bobo and three other special agents are sent to find them. They arrive in the middle of a war of liberation of the Escots. Lead by Princess Moneva, the rebels are summarily executing all who carry the logo of Wake: the sign of the demons!
name: The Sign of the Demons

description: Two stories in one book in a new handy format! In “Artifice”, feisty human agent Navee falls on a planet persecuted by a ruling class with little regard for life. She faces her coldest rival ever. In “Maximum (In)security”, she is given the task of dismantling a ring trafficking in planets but to do so she must retrieve Rib’Wund, a mercenary she worked with already out of a maximum security prison filled with ultra violent inmates! We also get to find out how she got those white bands across her body!
name: Artifice/Maximum (In)security

description:
1. Nancy 
 
2. Captain and the Kids 
 
3. Willie 
 
4. Casey Ruggles

1. Nancy 
 
2. Captain and the Kids 
 
3. Casey Ruggles (by Warren Tufts)

In a realm where sorcery meets science, The Masters of the Universe set forth to protect all of Eternia from the evil onslaught of Skeketor and his evil forces. It's an epic tale of good versus evil, where there is new danger and suspense at every turn. The story we all loved from the '80s is reborn and relaunched for a new era. The climactic conclusion to the Dark Reflection saga, as the evil man-at-arms attempts to breach the walls of Castle Grayskull, He-man and the Masters are busy with Skeletor and his minions. Can He-man stop the dimensional jumping Man-at-arms and return him to his dimension before all of eternia suffers his wrath?

deck: This issue consists entirely of stories reprinted from earlier Tales from the Crypt volumes.

description: In her quest to bring New Orleans to its knees, Marinette, the voodoo spirit of vengeance, turns an exclusive country club into a slaughterhouse. But as Ragman battles the bloodthirsty entity, danger strikes even closer to home.
name: Mange Moun!

description:
You asked for it, X-Fans, and now, you got it! Marvel.com asked you what Chris Claremont's next project should be. You, the fans, said you wanted to know what today's new generation of X-Men would be like if the Marvel Universe aged in real-time! Who are the children of the X-Men? And what happened to the original team, Professor X, and Magneto after more than 30 years of conflict, victories and tragedies? Now, at last, the answers arrive as beloved X-Men scribe Chris Claremont reveals an all-new generation of mutant teens!

Collects GeNext #1-5.

Homage cover to X-Men #138- X-Men in left background, GeNext team exiting to right foreground with duffel bag slung over shoulder.
name: GeNext
Frigidaire e Dintorni: Quei Cattivi Ragazzi

description: Ben and Sara's journey to DC takes a detour as they encounter Norman Tulley, a technology mogul determined to take advantage of the 'bugs' exodus. Meanwhile in Virginia, political conflict rages as men struggle to determine who will lead the country in the post-invasion world! Plus, the alien captive escapes!
name: Inherit The Earth

description: The aliens are gone, but they've left some of their technology behind. And that technology hides a dark secret that could prove more dangerous than ten million aliens. Plus, our cast members collide!
name: In Twenty Minutes

description: The nightmare continues as Batman battles Killer Croc, Mr. Freeze and Clayface while the child-killing Raggedy Man gets his just desserts and Dr. Jeremiah Arkham learns the truth behind the Amadeus Code. Nothing is what it seems, and as the layers of madness are stripped away, it's starting to look like the new Arkham Asylum is one big joke.
name: Part Three...The Ghost in the Machine

description: This special tribute pays homage to the history and origin of Marvel's First Family! Delve into the past, as many of Marvel's mightiest creators explore the Fantastic Four's history as adventurers!
"Tough Guy" is the title of the 2 page text story within...
name: Tough Guy

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The Fantastic 4th Voyage of Sinbad

description: In 1961, a quartet of intrepid explorers rocketed into space, were bathed in mysterious Cosmic Rays, and were transformed into the fabulous Fantastic Four! Mr. Fantastic, brilliant inventor with an elastic body! Invisible Woman, master of force fields! Human Torch, flaming hotshot! The Thing, monstrous man of might! In the years that have followed, this dynamic nuclear family has challenged the unknown, saving our world multiple times from the threat of alien invaders, scientists gone mad, and other-dimensional despots! Now writer/artist Erik Larsen and a host of terrific talents ask "What if Stan Lee and Jack Kirby concluded their historic run on FF with one last wild adventure?" The answer begins at the world famous Baxter Building, home of our famous foursome, which is pillaged and looted by none other than the team's arch-nemesis, Dr. Doom! What is the man in the iron mask looking for? And what does the Mad Thinker have to do with all this? Find out in a year-long tribute to the heroes that ushered in the Marvel Age of Comics!
name: The Baxter Building Besieged!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: "Saturday Night Date" is the title of the 2 page text story within...
name: Saturday Night Date

name: Winter Worries!

description: Someone is trying to assassinate Marc Spector, but before he can find out why, the shooter kills himself. Crawley informs Marc of strange experiments being conducted on homeless people, so Marc investigates and discovers that The Company is behind them. Marc contacts an old colleague (and fling), Candace Calder, who still works for them, and arranges a meeting, much to Marlene's dismay. During the meeting, Marc is shot at, and after taking chase, the assassins kill themselves also.
name: Book One: Top Secret

description:
After the attack on Marc and Candace at the aquarium, the assassins killed themselves rather than talk.  Now Candace tells Marc about implants in her brain, mind control, and the CIA's plan to create perfect zombie-robot killers.
 
The red dragon tattoos found on the assassins lead Candace to believe the man behind the plot is Aleister Ravenna, the Red Dragon.  He may have opened a portal to another dimension in the late 1940s, allowing aliens to come through.
 
As Moon Knight prepares to go to the scene of a crime where symbols identical to those in Candace's notes were found, he is attacked by Marlene!
name: Book Two: Weird Wide Web

description:
After attacking Moon Knight, Marlene is revealed to have the red dragon symbol on the back of her blouse.  She escapes downstairs, but Moon Knight encounters Marlene without the symbol, unaware of what just happened.
 
As Moon Knight investigates the symbols at the warehouse crime scene, Marlene is attacked at home, and supposedly implanted with the same chip in her head as Candace.  Marc takes Marlene to a hypnotherapist where she reveals that she was abducted by aliens!
 
Meanwhile, Candace has been kidnapped by Red Dragon, who is still alive and apparently unaged from the 60 year-old photos.  She's about to be killed when Moon Knight arrives to rescue her.  Red Dragon flees, and as Moon Knight chases, he comes across a real flying saucer!
name: Book Three: Mind Maze

description:
After Moon Knight frees Candace, Isaac Rosslyn is able to take control of his mind because of their close proximity.  He reveals that the Brotherhood of the Red Dragon, led by Germain Royce, are behind the plans for mind control.
 
As Frenchie and Marlene approach to help, their helicopter crashes.  Frenchie calls Moon Knight on the radio and the signal interferes with the Rosslyn's control of Moon Knight, allowing him to break free.  
 
After defeating Rosslyn, Moon Knight is in for one final battle with Germain Royce, the Red Dragon.
name: Book Four: Dragon's Madness

description: Continuing Marvel's star-studded celebration of the Fantastic Four's 40th Anniversary! If you're a fan of the FF (and who isn't), this is the issue for you: Dr. Doom! Crystal! The Sub-Mariner! The Kree Sentry! The Fantasti-Car! An all-star cast of creators including Erik Larsen, Keith Giffen, Ron Frenz, Paul Ryan and Joe Sinnott deliver all-out action in the Mighty Marvel Manner!
name: The Sinister Secret of the Sentry!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: Continuing Marvel's star-studded celebration of the Fantastic Four's 40th Anniversary! Who is the evil genius behind the recent attacks on the FF? If Namor and the Kree Sentry weren't enough, now our fab foursome must contend with the X-Men, Spider-Man, Dr. Strange and the mutant-hunting Sentinels! Erik Larsen, Keith Giffen, Ron Frenz, Tom DeFalco, Joe Sinnott and more deliver Mighty Marvel Action in the classic Lee/Kirby tradition!
name: When Strike These Sentinels!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: Continuing Marvel's star-studded celebration of the Fantastic Four's 40th Anniversary! It's more wild action in the Mighty Marvel Manner guest-starring the X-Men, Captain America, the Falcon and Dr. Doom!
name: The Merciless Menace Of MODOK!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: Continuing Marvel's year-long celebration of the FF's 40th Anniversary in the classic Lee/Kirby tradition! As the Fantastic Four come to grips with the fact that they're being manipulated by a hated enemy, the Hulk goes on a riotous rampage, setting the stage for a classic clash between ol' Jade Jaws and the ever-lovin' blue-eyed Thing!
name: New York Knockdown!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: Continuing Marvel's star-studded celebration of the FF's 40th Anniversary! Everyone from the Black Panther to Nick Fury to the Silver Surfer guest stars as Mr. Fantastic races against time to unravel the master plan of Dr. Doom!
name: Mayhem on the Moon!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: Continuing Marvel's year-long celebration of the FF's 40th Anniversary in the classic Lee/Kirby tradition! Dr. Doom continues his quest for power ? but what is his ultimate goal? And exactly how will the Inhumans play a part in helping him attain it?
name: ...Touched By the Hand of Havoc!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine
Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description:
With all of reality in the hands of Dr. Doom and the Cosmic Cube, can even the mighty Thor save the day?

The story begins in the Baxter Building with Mr. Fantastic using a sophisticated computer of his in an attempt to anticipate Doom's next move, while the Thing and the Human Torch look on. The Invisible Girl says farewell to Namor at the East River, accompanied by Crystal. Sue pleads with Namor to work with her and the rest of the Fantastic Four in their battle against Doctor Doom, but as he leaves he refuses to promise anything. Back at the Baxter Building, an image appears before the eyes of Reed, Ben and Johnny that shows Cosmic Energy radiating from Doctor Doom.

Rick Jones rushes to the Baxter Building and he warns Ben, Reed and Johnny that Doom has invaded the Negative Zone. As Rick Jones explains, we briefly see Doom, Annihilus and Captain Mar-vell in the Negative Zone. Back at the Baxter Building, Reed, Ben, Johnny and Crystal prepare to leave for the Negative Zone. Sue seems hurt that she is being left behind, but her husband explains that someone has to monitor their progress on the Visi-Screen. As a despondent Invisible Girl watches them leave, she tells Rick Jones that it is so hard to be left behind.. waiting and wondering. Suddenly, the Sandman's mighty fist smashes into the face of Rick Jones. Briefly switching back to the Negative Zone, we see Doom stealing the Cosmic Control Rod from Annihilus.

At the Baxter Building again, the Sandman's hammer-like fist repeatedly smashes against the Invisible Girl's force field. Sandman announces that he can already feel her force field beginning to weaken. Unable to hold her force field any longer, the Invisible Girl is forced to lower her shield. Rejoicing as he watches the blonde girl try and stagger slowly away, Sandman says that he knew she would buckle under the pressure. Suddenly, Blastaar enters the scene and fires a power blast at Sue. Sandman, Wizard, Trapster and Blastaar look down at an unconscious Invisible Girl. Wizard tells Trapster to restrain her with his paste gun.

Meanwhile, back in the Negative Zone, the three male members of the Fantastic Four and Crystal battle Annihilus and his allies. Captain Marvel sees that they are outnumbered and need help. However, before he can assist them, Rick Jones uses his wrist bands to change places with him and Captain Marvel suddenly appears at the Baxter Building. A lengthy battles continues in the Negative Zone and the Fantastic Four seem to be holding their own against Annihilus. At the Baxter Building, Captain Marvel tries to battle the Frightful Four. Susan Storm Richards has regained consciousness, but she is bound to the floor by the Trapster's paste bonds. Blastaar quickly disposes of Captain Marvel. Annihilus takes Rick Jones hostage in the Negative Zone. The FF agree to return with Annihilus' Cosmic Control Rod, in exchange for the life of Rick Jones. However, Mr. Fantastic is very concerned as they near the portal with the Baxter Building, as Sue should have seen them and opened the portal for their return. Reed announces that something must be terribly wrong. The Frightful Four and Sue watch Mr. Fantastic, the Thing, the Human Torch and Crystal on the Visi-Screen and see that they are unable to return home. A triumphant Wizard proclaims that Reed Richards is never leaving the Negative Zone... A paste-bound Invisible Girl looks on helplessly, as she says "Oh, Reed! How... When you need me the most...I... I'm trapped... and helpless!"
name: Nightmare In The Negative Zone!

volume.name: Fantastic Four: The World's Greatest Comics Magazine

description: The FF's fortieth-anniversary special rockets towards its conclusion! Did the Fantastic Four survive last issue's bout with the Asgardians? Is this the World's Greatest Funeral Magazine? No way! Gearing up for the big finale we bring you Planet Doom -- and the return of the Cosmic Cube-wielding dictator of Latveria!
name: Doom Triumphant!
